node.title: The deadly new risk Afghan women face: It starts with a strange phone call and can end with murder
node.alt: A group of women hold signs and shout on the streets of Kabul.
node.description: There were warnings that women's rights activists in Afghanistan were in danger, Now, they are disappearing and being killed in the streets.Â
node.content:
["In September, Forouzan Safi joined other activists to protest\u00a0against the Taliban\u00a0tearing down the rights of women in Afghanistan.\u00a0", "By late October, she had\u00a0been killed.\u00a0", "She reportedly left the house that day with her passport and degrees, believing she was meeting up with someone who would help her get out of Afghanistan.\u00a0", "Her body was found riddled with bullets alongside\u00a0three other women who had also been killed.", "News of their deaths has been reverberating around the community of activists who are fighting for the advancement of women and girls and who have lived in fear since the Taliban regained power.\u00a0", "", "
Forouzan Safi was an economics lecturer in northern Afghanistan.\u00a0(Supplied:\u00a0Nilofar Ayoubi)
", "Ms Safi was a civil rights advocate and an economics lecturer in the northern Afghan city of Mazar-e-Sharif .\u00a0", "\"Forouzan was one of many young women activists who had dreams to have\u00a0a beautiful life, to have her basic rights, to live in peace, to pursue her dreams, but unfortunately she couldn't make it,\" her friend\u00a0Nilofar Ayoubi told the ABC.\u00a0", "\"She was one of the woman protesters from the Mazar-e-Sharif group who were protesting after August 15, and then she was recognised with another three women activists by Taliban and unfortunately they were trapped to their deaths.\"\u00a0", "Ms Ayoubi is a journalist and activist who left Afghanistan over concerns for her own safety.", "She is well connected to the network of human and women's rights activists in Afghanistan and says\u00a0Ms Safi knew something was wrong in the lead-up to her disappearance.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"She had messaged one of our fellow sisters a few days before the incident [saying] she's not feeling safe in WhatsApp \u2026\u00a0and that she'll be available on Signal.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"Since the situation was so tense at that time, nobody noticed the absence of her in the group chat then after a few days the news came out and her body was found, along with another three activist sisters.\"\u00a0", "", "
The bodies of four women were found in the northern Afghanistan city of Mazar-e-Sharif(ABC News:\u00a0Farshad Usyan)
", "Some activists have reported receiving phone calls, messages and emails from suspicious people who claimed they could help those wanting to leave Afghanistan.", "They are\u00a0reportedly asked to share personal details and are invited to come to certain locations.", "Two suspects have confessed to luring Ms Safi and the three other women to the house where their bodies were found.\u00a0", "A\u00a0Taliban spokesperson said the suspects had\u00a0been arrested in connection with the killings, but\u00a0did not say whether they also\u00a0confessed to the killings.\u00a0", "He said\u00a0the case was being\u00a0referred to a court.", "Human Rights Watch associate director for women's rights Heather Barr told the ABC: \"The Taliban created an environment where women like Safi are really walking around with the target on their back.\"\u00a0", "\"And it seems like there's impunity for people who would attack and kill them.\"", "
Families urge protesters to stay home
", "Ms Ayoubi said a list of women attending at least one protest in Kabul had been obtained by Taliban fighters.\u00a0", "\"Taliban started circling them and reading their name one by one and threatened them, [saying] 'if we can know the exact name and number of you who are currently present in this protest, then it's very easy for us to find you and hunt you down',\" she said.\u00a0\u00a0", "One woman still in Afghanistan, who helped organise several protests, told the ABC the Taliban had threatened her directly.\u00a0", "\"We are still hiding ourselves and we don't know how to continue our lives \u2026\u00a0we are jobless in this situation.\u00a0", "\"I really love my country, but since the Taliban [regained power] it became like hell and we are burning in this hell.\"\u00a0\u00a0", "The ABC has hidden her identity for security reasons.\u00a0", "Ms Ayoubi believes the assassination in Mazar-e-Sharif will extinguish the last throes of fighting for women's rights in Afghanistan.\u00a0", "\"With this assassination, I think the Taliban succeeded in creating the fear and the horror in the families to stop their women, girls, daughters, wives protesting,\" she said.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"I'm afraid that if it continues like this \u2026\u00a0then in no time these voices will be lost.", "
'Incredibly alarming development'
", "As the last US plane left Afghanistan and the official evacuation effort came to a close, one woman who once worked in the Afghan security forces told the ABC Taliban fighters were searching \"home to home\" for her and her colleagues.", "Ms Barr from Human Rights Watch told the ABC the situation in Afghanistan was now \"really, really dark\".\u00a0", "\"People had all these fears about how the Taliban would govern. And now we've had almost three months to find out \u2026\u00a0and\u00a0we've learned that most of those fears were justified,\" she said.\u00a0", "There have been documented revenge and reprisal killings in Afghanistan, including members of the resistance movement and the former security forces.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"From the beginning, it was clear that they were also trying to track down women's rights activists and other human rights activists,\" Ms Barr said.\u00a0", "\"And even if they weren't killing those people, they were certainly trying to frighten them and trying to silence them.\"\u00a0", "Ms Barr said there had been a question about whether the intimidation of women's rights activists would escalate to killings.", "Forouzan Safi's death provided a chilling answer.\u00a0", "Ms Barr believes the United Nations should investigate\u00a0the specific crimes against women.\u00a0", "\"There has to be an investigation, there has to be a real investigation of who killed her, and why and consequences and justice for her family,\" she said.\u00a0", "
Australia's aid to persecuted Afghans
", "", "
Hadia (pictured centre), is 10 years old and in grade four. In two years' time, she will be too old to be allowed to attend school.\u00a0(Reuters:\u00a0Zohra Bensemra)
", "Ms Ayobi said she was trying very hard to get women within her network out of Afghanistan.\u00a0", "\"Because they are the history of 20 years of activism. Twenty\u00a0years of fighting for the rights and freedom, and my only hope is that we manage to save as many of these women as we can,\" she said.\u00a0\u00a0", "Susan Hutchinson is an advocate for women and someone who has been instrumental in helping at-risk Afghans make it out.\u00a0", "She believes the Australian government\u00a0could be doing more to help\u00a0women still in danger in Afghanistan.", "\"The practical reality does not meet the rhetoric in terms of getting high-risk women's human rights defenders out of Afghanistan,\" she said.", "Thousands of Afghans have already come to Australia on temporary protection visas.", "From there, they must apply for a place in Australia's humanitarian program.\u00a0", "The federal government promised 3,000 places in the annual humanitarian program would be allocated to people fleeing violence in Afghanistan.\u00a0", "But this week, a Senate inquiry heard Australia had not yet issued any of those visas to Afghans who had applied.\u00a0", "The inquiry also heard there had been more than 32,000 applications, but with many often involving entire families, the actual number of applicants is believed to be at least 150,000.\u00a0", "When the government initially announced 3,000 places in the humanitarian program would be given to Afghans, it said that allocation would focus on \"family members of Australians, persecuted minorities such as women and girls, children, the Hazara and other vulnerable groups\".", "In a statement, a spokesperson for\u00a0DFAT said Afghans remained a priority for the 2021-22 humanitarian visa program.\u00a0", "They maintained \"particular priority\" would be given to persecuted minorities, women and children and those who have links to Australia.", "\"We will also continue to utilise our close working relationship with the United Nations High Commission for Refugees (UHNCR) to identify those Afghans most in need,\" the spokesperson said.\u00a0\u00a0", "Ms Hutchinson said the government had the ability to issue more temporary visas to women still in Afghanistan. \u00a0", "\"It seems to me there are no practical mechanisms that the government is using to get these women out of harm's way,\" she said.\u00a0"]
